## R packages

Für die folgenden Analysen werden zwei R Pakete benötigt:

```{r setup}
library(lisr)
library(tidyverse)
```

## Data import

```{r import}
data <- map_df(2014:2019, get_lis_babynames) 
```

## Data exploration

```{r variables}
colnames(data)
```

## Data wrangling

```{r wrangling}

data <- data %>% 
   rename(RANK = RANG)
top.10_boys <- data %>%
  filter(GESCHLECHT == 'm') %>%
  filter(RANK <= 10) %>%
  pull(VORNAME) %>%
  unique()

top.10_girls <- data %>%
  filter(GESCHLECHT == 'w') %>%
  filter(RANK <= 10) %>%
  pull(VORNAME) %>%
  unique()


df.top.10_boys <- data %>%
  filter(GESCHLECHT == 'm') %>%
  filter(VORNAME %in% top.10_boys) %>%
  select(-GESCHLECHT, -RANG_GESAMT)

df.top.10_girls <- data %>%
  filter(GESCHLECHT == 'w') %>%
  filter(VORNAME %in% top.10_girls) %>%
  select(-GESCHLECHT, -RANG_GESAMT)
```


## Data visualisation

```{r boys-top-10}
ggplot(df.top.10_boys,
       aes(x = YEAR, y = RANK, colour = VORNAME)) +
  scale_y_reverse(breaks = seq(1, 10, 1), limits = c(10, 1)) +
   geom_line(aes(group = VORNAME), linetype = 3) +
  geom_label(aes(label = VORNAME), fill = "#1e1e1e", hjust = 'center') +
  hrbrthemes::theme_modern_rc() +
  theme(legend.position = 'none',
        panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank()) +
  expand_limits(x = c(2013.8, 2019.1)) +
  ggsci::scale_color_d3("category20") +
  labs(title = 'Most popular male babynames',
       subtitle = '2014 - 2019')

```

```{r girls-top-10}
ggplot(df.top.10_girls,
       aes(x = YEAR, y = RANK, colour = VORNAME)) +
  scale_y_reverse(breaks = seq(1, 10, 1), limits = c(10, 1)) +
  geom_line(aes(group = VORNAME), linetype = 3) +
  geom_label(aes(label = VORNAME), fill = "#1e1e1e") +
  hrbrthemes::theme_modern_rc() +
  theme(legend.position = 'none',
        panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank()) +
  expand_limits(x = c(2013.8, 2019.1)) +
  ggsci::scale_color_d3("category20") +
    labs(title = 'Most popular female babynames',
       subtitle = '2014 - 2019')
```


```{r tab-names}
library(DT)
tab <- data %>% 
  select(Year = YEAR, Name = VORNAME, Number = ANZAHL, Rank_Sex = RANK, Rank_Total = RANG_GESAMT) %>%   arrange(Year, Rank_Total) %>% 
  filter(Number > 1)
datatable(tab,
          colnames = c('Year', 'Name', 'Number', 'Rank (Sex)', 'Rank (Total)'),
          filter = 'top')
```
